title: Hankiralli
text: The Hankiralli is a <a href="Finland">Finnish</a> motor <a href="Rallying">rally</a>, in the <a href="Europe">Europe</a>an Championship. In 1981, Finnish driver <a href="Ulf%20Gr%C3%B6nholm">Ulf Grönholm</a> was killed in practice for this event. His son, <a href="Marcus%20Gr%C3%B6nholm">Marcus Grönholm</a>, later went on to become the 2000 and 2002 World Champion rally driver. <a href="Sweden">Swedish</a> driver <a href="Stig%20Blomqvist">Stig Blomqvist</a> won the event twice, in 1971 and 1977, in a <a href="Saab%2096">Saab 96</a> V4.
